physical_appearance: The image shows a rectangular colour photograph. The surrounding frame has patterns all over its body. The photograph depicts a Peranakan family. There are a total of seven people in the portrait, comprising of two adults and five children. All of them except for the adult male are wearing their ethnic costumes. The adult male is wearing a coat over a shirt with a tie and pants with shoes. The background suggests that this was taken in the interior of building.
sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a nyonya and baba, who are both seated and surrounded by five children. 

Photographs were sometimes painted, usually by an artist who first applied Chinese ink or oil paint to the negative before further working on the print. With the advent of colour negative film in the 1950s, hand-tinted photographs fell out of vogue.
